## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've heard some concerns about miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running in DeFi protocols. How does the Verus DeFi protocol address these problems?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus DeFi protocol has a solution for these issues. It ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This provides fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities. By doing so, Verus prevents MEV and front-running, creating a more fair and secure environment for its users.

**User:**
That's great to hear! I've also been wondering about the significance of simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches in Verus. Can you explain that to me?

**AI Assistant:**
In Verus, simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches allow for the creation of a new blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool. This enables seamless connectivity between the new blockchain and other blockchains, with all fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool being earned on the new blockchain, without any rent going back to the Verus blockchain. This is a unique feature of Verus, allowing for a more decentralized and community-driven approach to blockchain development.

**User:**
I'm also interested in the blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches in Verus. How do they work, and what happens if the minimum participation levels are not met?

**AI Assistant:**
In Verus, blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches allow users to set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in their preferred currencies on-chain. If the minimum levels are not met by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically receive a refund of all their pre-conversions, less the network fees. This ensures that users are protected in case the minimum participation levels are not reached. It's a secure and transparent way to launch new currencies, giving users more control and confidence in the process.
How does the Verus DeFi protocol address the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running?

The Verus DeFi protocol solves the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running by ensuring that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. This provides fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities.

currencies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
### Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
- Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
### Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral c
